node.title: Without transparency, Facebook Meta's mental health study 'doomed to fail', academics say
node.description: A group of international scholars says Meta should release internal research on how the platform impacts youth mental health with current efforts "doomed to fail".
node.content:
["Almost 300 international academics\u00a0have signed an open letter to Mark Zuckerberg\u00a0calling for greater transparency and independent oversight of Meta's research into youth mental health.", "It comes two months after whistleblower Frances Haugen told US Congress that the social network causes harm to young users\u00a0and \"intentionally hides vital information from the public\".", "In the open letter, the \"global coalition of scholars\" states Meta's \"research is happening behind closed doors and without independent oversight\".", "\"With three billion people using Meta platforms for socialising, leisure, and business it is highly plausible that these virtual environments have far-reaching effects on the mental health of younger users \u2014 in both positive and negative ways,\" the letter reads.", "\"While we applaud these attempts to understand how your platforms may be impacting young people's mental health, we believe that the methodologically questionable and secretive ways your teams are conducting this important work is misguided and, in its present state, doomed to fail.\"", "A Meta spokesperson said understanding social media's impact on youth mental health was \"an industry-wide challenge\".", "\"A survey from just last month suggested that more US teens are using TikTok and YouTube than Instagram or Facebook, which is why we need an industry-wide effort to understand the role of social media in young people's lives.\"", "
Independent research 'needs access'
", "The letter calls for \"independent and transparent reviews of all past, present, and future research\" on youth mental health\u00a0along with the company contributing to independent studies, including in non-English speaking countries.", "It also suggests expanding Meta's\u00a0Oversight Board\u00a0to conduct independent evaluations of the platform's mental health risks.", "One of the\u00a0286 signatories so far,\u00a0Associate Professor Kathryn Modecki from Griffith University's School of Applied Psychology,\u00a0said \"the only agenda here is excellent, rigorous science\".", "\"It's a call for saying the internal standards [of Meta's research] need to match external standards for scientific rigour,\" Dr Modecki said.", "She said a peer review process was needed to \"look for soundness of method, soundness of inferences, looking at the sample, the questions we're asking\".", "", "
Associate Professor Kathryn Modecki is one of hundreds of signatories.(Supplied: Kathryn Modecki)
", "\u201cWe don't see that happening at Facebook. There's absolutely no transparency in terms of the science that's happening,\" she said.", "\"Nor is there access for independent scientists to access the data that exists within Facebook itself.", "\"In the absence of transparency, very negative stories from the media have\u00a0arisen [and]\u00a0it's really hard to counter any of that without\u00a0any access to what's happening.\"", "
Unclear research standards
", "A leaked\u00a0internal Facebook report\u00a0detailed surveys with a group\u00a0of teens who blamed\u00a0Instagram for increased rates of depression and anxiety.", "\"This reaction was unprompted and consistent across all groups,\" the report read.", "While it stated that issues around \"social comparison and perfectionism\" were not new, the report noted: \"Young people are dealing with this on an unprecedented scale\".", "However, annotated notes from Meta outlined that those conclusions were\u00a0\"not intended to be representative of the experiences of all teens\", with a survey size of just 40 participants.", "Meta has also introduced new Instagram functions to \"nudge\" teens away from harmful content and prompt them\u00a0to \"take a break\".", "But Dr Modecki said Meta's internal research standards were \"completely unclear\".", "\"There is a recognition that research needs to happen within Facebook, obviously. On\u00a0the other hand, it's not happening alongside independent scholarship,\" she said.", "\"The lack of access to data in some ways feeds this myth that this is all toxic, this all problematic.\"", "
'Unprecedented opportunity'
", "Dr\u00a0Modecki said external research had\u00a0\"mixed findings\" on social media's mental health impact.", "\"The research suggests that for kids who are already at risk with depression or body image challenges\u00a0their problems may become exacerbated online,\" she said.", "\"But overall we don't see this blanket negative effect.", "\"I have a study that shows moderate amounts of going online to cope with stressors can actually be really helpful for adolescents.\"", "Dr Modecki said access to Meta's internal data would be \"the most unprecedented opportunity that exists in terms of supporting youth\".", "\"There is an obligation, given that this is where youth are spending their time, to open up,\" she said."]
